This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-12T17:32:04Z Kylie Baldwin 2015-03-12T17:31:58+00:00 2015-03-12T17:31:58+00:00 FW: Sociology of donation session at BSA medsoc https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;2a1e6619.1503 Deconstructing donation In recent years we have witnessed heightened political and sociological interest in the donation of organs, gametes, blood and tissue, and in related activities of procurement, processing, banking and distribution. In thinking about the concept of donation, we would like to explore vital sociological questions: How is donation conceptualised and what kinds of relationships does it produce? What is the value of human body parts? How is donation practiced and regulated within local or international contexts? Our aim is to consider how or whether we can make sense of the fractured landscape which forms current sociological understanding of [...] Kylie Baldwin 2015-03-09T11:11:04+00:00 2015-03-09T11:11:04+00:00 FW: 'Making Parents: Assisted Reproduction and Parenting Culture in Contemporary Society' AAA 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;fd380a3f.1503 Call for Papers: American Anthropological Association Meetings Denver, CO, USA November 18-22nd 2015 Making parents: Assisted reproduction and parenting culture in contemporary society Organisers: Dr Charlotte Faircloth (University of Roehampton) and Dr Zeynep Gurtin (University of Cambridge) Panel Discussant: Professor Marcia Inhorn (Yale University) Whilst ‘Parenting Culture’ and ‘Assisted Reproductive Technologies’ are now well-established subfields of anthropological scholarship, so far, the common threads between these two bodies of work have not been significantly explored. Taking ‘reproduction’ as the locus of this comparison, this panel will showcase novel contributions from scholars working in either field who are interested in creating such [...] Charlotte Faircloth 2015-03-09T11:07:05+00:00 2015-03-09T11:07:05+00:00 CFP: 'Making Parents: Assisted Reproduction and Parenting Culture in Contemporary Society' AAA 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;46c4c306.1503 - With apologies for cross-posting, please circulate to your lists -<br><br>Call for Papers: American Anthropological Association Meetings<br><br>Denver, CO, USA November 18-22nd 2015<br><br>Making parents: Assisted reproduction and parenting culture in contemporary society<br><br>Organisers: Dr Charlotte Faircloth (University of Roehampton) and Dr Zeynep Gurtin (University of Cambridge)<br><br>Panel Discussant: Professor Marcia Inhorn (Yale University) [...] Claire.Norman 2015-02-24T10:43:16+00:00 2015-02-24T10:43:16+00:00 *** Registration now open *** Understanding the Young Sexual Body Symposium ***** https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;c22d8eb9.1502 ***Registration is now open***<br>Understanding the Young Sexual Body Symposium<br>Exploring young sexualities: research-practice entanglements<br><br>Date: 24th April 2015 10am-5.30pm<br>Venue: The Open University London, 1-11 Hawley Crescent, Camden Town, Camden, London NW1 8NP<br>The Open University is pleased to invite you to a follow-up event to the successful ESRC funded seminar series on Understanding the Young Sexual Body. This symposium will embrace the overall aim of the series: to develop partnerships and creative dialogue, between leading academics and practitioners concerned with young people's sexual health. [...] Jessica Davies 2015-02-24T10:28:49+00:00 2015-02-24T10:28:49+00:00 PhD studentship: Reproductive decision-making amongst women with Turner Syndrome https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;4f68a3e2.1502 Please note that the deadline for applications for the scholarship below has been extended until 30th March 2015.<br><br>Dear colleagues<br><br>Reproductive decision-making, parenthood and the use of assisted conception amongst women with Turner Syndrome: an exploratory study<br><br>A PhD research scholarship including stipend and tuition fee costs is offered within the Reproduction Research Group at De Montfort University. It is available to UK or EU students who are suitably qualified and have outstanding potential as a researcher. [...] Sam Murphy 2015-02-18T14:42:41+00:00 2015-02-18T14:42:41+00:00 London MedSoc event February 25th https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;7ae84ec1.1502 Posted on behalf of Oliver Bonnington:<br><br>PLEASE NOTE THIS SEMINAR IS AT TAVISTOCK PLACE<br><br>We are very pleased to announce the second London Medical Sociology Group seminar of 2015:<br><br>Wednesday 25th February 6-7 pm 'Does IVF Exacerbate Infertility?<br><br>Speaker: Professor Sarah Franklin, University of Cambridge<br><br>This presentation returns to the origins of UK IVF in Oldham, Lancashire to complicate the seemingly obvious relationship between IVF and infertility. It also explores how IVF may exacerbate the condition of unwanted childlessness it is intended to relieve. Turning to the present-day, I will argue that it is only by more fully appreciating the [...] Ellie Lee 2015-02-17T14:34:30+00:00 2015-02-17T14:34:30+00:00 Letter on Sex selection to sign https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;2b4b81fc.1502 Hi all<br><br>This has come to me from Lisa Hallgarten, at Voice for Choice. If you want your name to be on this as a signatory, which would be great, can you email her to say so? Lisa Hallgarten [lhallgarten@rhmjournal.org.uk]<br><br>Hi,<br><br>I am writing to those of you (whose email addresses I have) who signed the letter to the Telegraph opposing the Fiona Bruce sex selection amendment. Please do forward this on to other signatories and anyone else you think would be interested.<br>Voice for Choice<http://www.vfc.org.uk/> opposes the amendment.<br>We will be sending MPs a letter later this week signed [...] Claire.Norman 2015-02-17T14:13:12+00:00 2015-02-17T14:13:12+00:00 *** Registration now open *** Understanding the Young Sexual Body Symposium ***** https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;8a21a06c.1502 ***Registration is now open***<br>Understanding the Young Sexual Body Symposium<br>Exploring young sexualities: research-practice entanglements<br><br>Date: 24th April 2015 10am-5.30pm<br>Venue: The Open University London, 1-11 Hawley Crescent, Camden Town, Camden, London NW1 8NP<br>The Open University is pleased to invite you to a follow-up event to the successful ESRC funded seminar series on Understanding the Young Sexual Body. This time she is collecting signatures for the letter (below) from women's organisations showing a response to the abortion/serious crime bill amendment which is distinctively opposed to the position being made by Jeena as a representative voice. [...] Ellie Lee 2015-02-04T13:06:02+00:00 2015-02-04T13:06:02+00:00 Sociology Compass (Science and Medicine) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;119322e9.1502 Dear all I am presently doing a stint as an Editor for the journal Sociology Compass. I’m mailing here to raise awareness of it generally (you might find it helpful for teaching and research), but also to suggest you consider thinking about it as a place to publish (or a place to encourage those you work with to publish). Compass as a project is rather different to other journals; as the name suggests its aim is to give an orientation or guide to the reader. It publishes short (up to 5000 word) articles, which give an overview of a body [...] Claire.Norman 2015-02-03T14:09:09+00:00 2015-02-03T14:09:09+00:00 *** Registration now open *** Understanding the Young Sexual Body Symposium ***** https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;7026320.1502 ***Registration is now open***<br>Understanding the Young Sexual Body Symposium<br>Exploring young sexualities: research-practice entanglements<br><br>Date: 24th April 2015 10am-5.30pm<br>Venue: The Open University London, 1-11 Hawley Crescent, Camden Town, Camden, London NW1 8NP<br>The Open University is pleased to invite you to a follow-up event to the successful ESRC funded seminar series on Understanding the Young Sexual Body. This symposium will embrace the overall aim of the series: to develop partnerships and creative dialogue, between leading academics and practitioners concerned with young people's sexual health. [...] Sam Murphy 2015-01-28T09:27:55+00:00 2015-01-28T09:27:55+00:00 ESRC seminar series on Breastfeedingg https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;1a426df5.1501 ESRC seminar series<br>Social experiences of breastfeeding: building bridges between research and policy<br>March 11th 2015<br>9:30AM-4:00PM (9.30-10 welcome, tea & coffee)<br>The Watershed Bristol Harbour, Bristol, UK<br><br>We are delighted to announce the first of a series of six ESRC-funded seminars focused on the social experiences of breastfeeding in the contemporary UK. The series seeks to bring together academics across a range of disciplines with those involved in breastfeeding education, practice, activism, and policy. Our aim is to further understanding of women\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds embodied, affective and day-to-day practices in trying to breastfeed, and talk about how these experiences might be [...] Lesley.Hoggart 2015-01-24T17:25:59+00:00 2015-01-24T17:25:59+00:00 pro-life amendment to Serious Crime Bill https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;e56c1f4e.1501 Dear all,<br><br>You may have noted that a pro-life amendment has been tabled to the Serious Crime Bill. www.qub.ac.uk/IfIWereJack<http://www.qub.ac.uk/IfIWereJack> Jenny Hislop 2015-01-13T11:10:16+00:00 2015-01-13T11:10:16+00:00 Qualitative Research Methods courses at University of Oxford https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-HUMAN-REPRODUCTION;329fd3b5.1501 * Apologies for any cross-posting *<br>The Health Experiences Research Group, Nuffield Department of Primary Care Health Sciences, University of Oxford is offering the following programme of qualitative research methods courses in the first half of 2015.<br>Our courses are very popular so please book early to avoid disappointment. Some of our courses are now fully booked but have a waiting list. For further details about each course or to make a booking, please go to<br>https://www.oxforduniversitystores.co.uk/browse/product.asp?catid=165&modid=5&compid=1<br>Please pass the information on to anyone who might be interested and/or display it on your noticeboards.<br>We look forward to welcoming you [...]
